definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: With the development of RFID technology, RFID is being applied ubiquitously in every field.
sentences.chinese: 隨着RFID技術的發展，RFID應用正無所不在。

sentences.english: Diversity is alive and rampant—at least in my life.
sentences.chinese: 至少在我的生活裏，多元是生機勃勃且無所不在的。

sentences.english: Racial discrimination is discernible everywhere in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，種族歧視無所不在。

sentences.english: To these gutty inventor, good luck is omnipresent.
sentences.chinese: 對於這些有勇氣的發明家，機遇無所不在。

sentences.english: Optimists insist opportunities still abound, but the stakes are undisputedly higher.
sentences.chinese: 樂觀主義者認爲機會無所不在，但是賭注正在變高。

sentences.english: Meaning God is everywhere. He is our home.
sentences.chinese: 意思是，神無所不在，祂就是我們的家。

sentences.english: City, as a shape, its interface is everywhere and various .
sentences.chinese: 作爲形體的城市，界面無所不在，各具形象。

sentences.english: "You're always aware of the criticism, " Alston, 31, said.
sentences.chinese: “你知道，批評無所不在，”31歲的阿爾斯通說。

sentences.english: He is the non-dual consciousness that is present everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 祂是無所不在的不二元性意識。

sentences.english: New members are everywhere, Dochterman said.
sentences.chinese: 新社員無所不在，陶德曼說。
